intro: Antirrhinum sagittatum, commonly known as the arrowhead snapdragon, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its distinctive arrow-shaped leaves and tall, spikes of bright red or orange flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in well-drained soil and full sunlight. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant for its vibrant blooms and ease of care. Antirrhinum sagittatum is also valued for its historical use in traditional medicine.
